title: getCellTxFraction. — getCellTxFraction
text: seu_obj seurat object. features Optional; vector gene identifiers perform calculation. NULL, features used.

title: getCellTxFraction. — getCellTxFraction
text: data frame probe type (Gene Control), mean expression values, associated sample platform identifiers.

title: getGlobalFDR — getGlobalFDR
text: Calculate Specificity Global False Discovery Rate (FDR).

title: getGlobalFDR — getGlobalFDR
text: seu_obj Seurat object containing spatial data, including path platform attribute. features optional vector feature names (gene names) calculate FDR. NULL (default), FDR calculated features seu_obj.

title: getGlobalFDR — getGlobalFDR
text: data frame columns sample_id, platform, calculated mean FDR across specified features.

title: getGlobalFDR — getGlobalFDR
text: Computes global FDR specified features (features default) Seurat object. leverages transcript localization data calculate FDR based proportion negative control blank barcode expressions compared expression actual genes.

title: getGlobalFDR — getGlobalFDR
code: res <- getGlobalFDR(seu_obj) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'seu_obj' not found res <- getGlobalFDR(seu_obj, features = c("Gene1", "Gene2")) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'seu_obj' not found

title: getMECR. — getMECR
text: calculates  Mutually Exclusive Co-expression Rate (MECR) Implementation.

title: getMECR. — getMECR
text: data frame containing sample_id, platform, computed MECR value. MECR value rounded three decimal places represents average mutually exclusive co-expression rate across selected markers.

title: getMaxDetection. — getMaxDetection
text: seu_obj seurat object. features Optional; vector gene identifiers perform calculation. NULL, features used.

title: getMaxRatio. — getMaxRatio
text: calculateds Log-ratio highest mean exp vs. mean noise.

title: getMaxRatio. — getMaxRatio
text: seu_obj seurat object. features Optional; vector gene identifiers perform calculation. NULL, features used.

title: getMeanExpression. — getMeanExpression
text: seu_obj seurat object. features Optional; vector gene identifiers perform calculation. NULL, features used.

title: getMeanExpression. — getMeanExpression
text: data frame probe type (Gene Control), mean expression values, associated sample platform identifiers.

title: getMeanSignalRatio. — getMeanSignalRatio
text: calculates log-ratio mean gene counts mean neg probe counts.

title: getMeanSignalRatio. — getMeanSignalRatio
text: seu_obj Seurat object. features Optional; specifies genes include calculation. NULL, genes RNA assay considered.

title: getMeanSignalRatio. — getMeanSignalRatio
text: data frame sample_id, platform, calculated mean log-ratio.

title: getMetrics. — getMetrics
code: getMetrics(   path = NULL,   mecr = TRUE,   autocorr = TRUE,   clusterSilhouette = TRUE,   sparsity = TRUE,   entropy = TRUE,   returnSeurat = FALSE,   sample_meta = NULL )

title: getMetrics. — getMetrics
text: path path directory containing sample folders. folder separate sample. mecr Logical; Default TRUE, calculates mean expression contrast ratio (MECR). autocorr Logical; Default TRUE, calculates Moran's autocorrelation statistic. clusterSilhouette Logical; Default TRUE, calculates cluster silhouette widths. sparsity Logical; Default TRUE, calculates sparsity data. entropy Logical; Default TRUE, calculates Shannon entropy. returnSeurat Logical; Default FALSE, TRUE, returns list original Seurat objects along calculated metrics. sample_meta optional data frame specifying sample metadata. provided, function attempts infer information directory structure.

title: getMetrics. — getMetrics
text: Depending value returnSeurat, function returns either list containing original Seurat objects metrics data frame, just metrics data frame.

title: getMetrics. — getMetrics
text: function processes collection spatial assay samples located specified path, folder corresponds separate sample. computes range spatial metrics, including mean expression, transcripts per cell, transcripts per area, signal--noise ratio, . function highly flexible, allowing user specify metrics calculate. Additionally, can return processed data Seurat object format needed.

title: getMorans. — getMorans
text: seu_obj seurat object. features character vector specifying features (genes probes) include analysis. NULL (default), features seu_obj used.

title: getMorans. — getMorans
text: data frame. data frame Moran's values feature (gene control probe), along sample ID, platform, gene/probe name, type (Gene Control). row corresponds feature, columns include sample identifier, platform used, Moran's value, gene/probe name, type indicating whether Gene-targeting probe Control probe.

title: getMorans. — getMorans
text: function first processes gene-targeting probes converting input data SingleCellExperiment object, SpatialFeatureExperiment object; Spatial coordinates specified used process data, including normalization nearest neighbor graph construction. Subsequently, Moran's calculated feature using Voyager package. process repeated control probes. results gene-targeting control probes combined single data frame. spatial autocorrelation analysis provides Moran's values feature, indicating degree spatial clustering. performed separately gene-targeting probes control probes, allowing comparison spatial patterns gene expression background noise.

title: getSparsity. — getSparsity
text: example, .99 sparsity means 99% values zero. Similarly, sparsity 0 means matrix fully dense.

text: seu_obj Seurat object. features Optional; vector gene identifiers perform calculation. NULL, features used.

title: getTxPerArea. — getTxPerArea

title: getTxPerCell. — getTxPerCell
text: Calculates average number transcripts per cell given features.

title: getTxPerCell. — getTxPerCell
text: seu_obj Seurat object. features Optional; vector features include calculation; NULL, features used.

title: getTxPerCell. — getTxPerCell
text: data frame containing sample_id, platform, average number transcripts per cell.

title: getTxPerCell. — getTxPerCell
text: Calculate Transcripts per Cell Calculates average number transcripts per cell given features. metric helps understanding transcriptomic richness cells spatial transcriptomics datasets.

title: getTxPerNuc. — getTxPerNuc
text: seu_obj Seurat object. features Optional; vector gene identifiers perform calculation. NULL, features used.

title: plotMetrics. — plotMetrics
code: plotMetrics(   metrics_list = NULL,   PlotAutocorr = T,   PlotSparsity = T,   PlotEntropy = T,   PlotClusterSilhouette = T,   ncol = 14,   nrow = 1,   rel_widths = c(0.75, 0.4, 0.5, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 0.75, 0.75, 0.8, 0.3,     0.8, 0.8) )

title: plotMetrics. — plotMetrics
text: metrics_list list containing metrics results. PlotAutocorr Logical; TRUE, plots autocorrelation metric. Default TRUE. PlotSparsity Logical; TRUE, plots sparsity metric;Default TRUE. PlotEntropy Logical; TRUE, plots entropy metric; Default TRUE. PlotClusterSilhouette Logical; TRUE, plots cluster silhouette metric; Default TRUE. ncol Integer; number columns plot grid; Default 14. nrow Integer; number rows plot grid; Default 1. rel_widths Numeric vector; relative widths columns plot grid.

title: plotPanelSize — plotPanelSize
text: df data frame expected contain sample_id value, value represents panel size.

title: plotPanelSize — plotPanelSize
text: ggplot object visualizing panel sizes samples.

title: plotSampleLabel — plotSampleLabel
text: sample_meta data frame containing least two columns: sample_id platform.

title: plotSampleLabel — plotSampleLabel
text: ggplot object representing sample labels colored platform.

title: readSpatial. — readSpatial
text: readSaptial reads data either Xenium, CosMx, MERSCOPE outputs seurat object common metadata e downstream comparison.

title: readSpatial. — readSpatial
text: sample_id Identifier sample processed. path file path load spatial transcriptomics data. platform platform data originates. Valid options 'Xenium', 'CosMx', 'Merscope'. Note: 'Merscope' currently supported.

title: readSpatial. — readSpatial
text: Returns Seurat object containing loaded processed spatial transcriptomics data, including sample metadata, cell metadata, embeddings tissue coordinates. structure content returned object vary depending platform.

title: readSpatial. — readSpatial
text: Reads preprocesses spatial transcriptomics data specified path given platform. function supports 'Xenium' 'CosMx' platforms, performing platform-specific loading preprocessing steps. includes loading data, annotating sample metadata, processing cell metadata. 'Xenium', adds additional cell metadata tissue coordinates embedding custom plotting. 'CosMx', fixes assays separate targeting non-targeting probes, adds additional cell metadata, includes tissue coordinates embedding. 'Merscope' platform support development. Regardless platform, data stored assay named "RNA" convenient platform, table used subsequent functions.

title: readSpatial. — readSpatial
code: seu_obj <- readSpatial(sample_id = "sample123", path = "path/to/xenium/data", platform = "Xenium") #> [1] "Reading: sample123" #> [1] "Loading Xenium data" #> Error in Read10X(data.dir = file.path(data.dir, "cell_feature_matrix/")): Directory provided does not exist seu_obj <- readSpatial(sample_id = "sample456", path = "path/to/cosmx/data", platform = "CosMx") #> [1] "Reading: sample456" #> [1] "Loading CosMx data" #> Error in ReadNanostring(data.dir = data.dir, type = c("centroids", "segmentations")): Cannot find Nanostring directory path/to/cosmx/data

title: readTxMeta. — readTxMeta
text: path file path read transcriptome metadata. platform platform transcriptome metadata read. Valid options 'Xenium', 'CosMx', 'Merscope'. Note: 'Merscope' currently supported.

title: readTxMeta. — readTxMeta
text: Returns data table transcriptome metadata. 'Xenium', 'feature_name' column renamed 'target'. 'CosMx', transcriptome file matching '*tx_file.csv.gz' read. return value 'Merscope' stops execution error message.

title: readTxMeta. — readTxMeta
text: function reads transcriptome metadata specified path, depending platform specified. Currently supports 'Xenium' 'CosMx' platforms. 'Xenium', reads 'transcripts.csv.gz' renames 'feature_name' column 'target' consistency. 'CosMx', reads appropriate transcriptome file matched '*tx_file.csv.gz'. 'Merscope' platform support development. platform, table used subsequent functions.
